title: Sochi
summary: Sochi (Russian: Со́чи, IPA: [ˈsotɕɪ] (listen)) is the largest resort city in Russia. The city is situated on the Sochi River, along the Black Sea in Southern Russia, with a population of 443,562 residents,[11] up to 600,000 residents in the urban area. The city proper covers an area of 176.77 square kilometers (68.25 sq mi),[5] while the Greater Sochi Area covers over 3,502 square kilometers (1,352 sq mi).[5] Sochi stretches across 145 kilometers (90 mi) from north to south. It is the longest city in the Eastern Hemisphere and second-longest city in the world, ahead of Perth (123 km) and trailing only Mexico City (200 km).[12][13] Sochi is the fifth-largest city in the Southern Federal District, the second-largest city in Krasnodar Krai, and the sixth-largest city around the Black Sea.
